alert.note: Alert for Baker; Calhoun; Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:37AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Clay, northwestern Baker, Calhoun and northern Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 1130 AM EDT... At 1037 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Fort Gaines to 11 miles southwest of Edison to near Blakely. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgan, Blakely, Edison, Arlington, Leary, Douglasville, Damascus, Bellville, Bluffton, Iveys Mill, Parksville, Early Co A/p, Suttons Corner, Rowena, Harrisons Mill, Zetto, Crestview, Moye, Cordrays Mill and Colomokee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EDT for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
